fr.sii.ogham.sms.splitter

Class StringSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.sms.splitter.StringSegment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Segment

    public class StringSegment
extends Object
implements Segment
    A segment initialized from a string. The charset used to encode the string to a byte array is also tracked in order to indicate which encoding was used.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringSegment

        public StringSegment(String message)
        Initializes the segment with a message. The default charset of the platform is used. WARNING: As the default charset for the platform is used, it may lead to inconsistencies.
        Parameters:
        message - the text for the segment

      • StringSegment

        public StringSegment(String message,
                     Charset charset)
        Initializes the segment with a message. The message string is encoded to a byte array using the provided charset.
        Parameters:
        message - the text for the segment
        charset - the charset to use for encoding the string to a byte array

      • StringSegment

        public StringSegment(String message,
                     String charsetName)
              throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Initializes the segment with a message. The message string is encoded to a byte array using the provided charset name.
        Parameters:
        message - the text for the segment
        charsetName - the charset name to use for encoding the string to a byte array
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException - when the charset could not be found

    • Method Detail

        public byte[] getBytes()
        Description copied from interface: Segment
        Returns the segment text as a byte array (partial message).
        Specified by:
        getBytes in interface Segment
        Returns:
        the byte array for the segment

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage()
        Returns:
        the original message

      • getCharsetName

        public String getCharsetName()
        Returns:
        the charset name used to encode the original message string to a byte array
